Reviews.Title: 5 star camera with 4 star results.
Reviews.Author: Brian Douthit "BMD"
Reviews.Content: It is a very enjoyable camera with some limitations -- but, what else would you expect as no camera of this type is perfect.  I am generally a very picky shooter, I have had to lower my expectations with this camera but I feel it is a certainly capable camera if you aren't expecting it to be perfect.  Sounds like a back-handed compliment but it really isn't, this really is the only camera of its kind when you consider the size, features, and capabilities.PROS- good photo quality, in most situations- very quick and responsive from the shutterlag to the touchscreen- great features from the very good video mode(with zoom and good audio) to the panorama and hand-held twilight mode- stylish, I wouldn't buy the camera because of this but when you compare it to any other waterproof camera it makes them look toyish- memory stick pro duo AND SDHC support!- and of course its waterproof and durable, the biggest selling point.CONS- battery life is short, about average for todays small cameras but I'd recommend a spare battery for most anyone just in case.  The battery does charge fast though.- limited control, I'd love for it to have some control over saturation, contrast, and sharpness.  Aperature/Shutterspeed control would be great as well...- very saturated and 'poppy' image quality, to me it is just fine but it is not subtle and you cant really control it in camera.- awkward media cable port.  I generally do not use these and mainly just use a card reader but if I were to use the cable I wouldn't like it.Overall, if you are getting this camera for the purpose of being waterproof(and more durable than normal) then you will be pleased with everything else it offers.  There are as good or better cameras out there for specific functions but if you are looking for a camera that takes good photos, is snappy, has a bunch of fun and usable features, and is waterproof then this should be very high if not at the top of your list!

Reviews.Title: Small, Nice Features, super fast, but variable Image quality
Reviews.Author: Carson Lawall "C. L."
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera (Sony Cyber-shot Tx5) to replace a 2 year old olympus stylus tough that had leaked and to supplement a Fuji Finepix F200 EXR with waterproof case.  This will be a little comparison for waterproof cameras and cased cameras.  Skip to the bottom if you just want to read about the cyber-shot.The olympus was a pretty good camera, mediocre to good image quality, slow as far as shutter lag, and unfortunately it eventually leaked after 2 years.  I used it for surfing pictures, which is pretty rough on a camera.  As advice for people using cameras in salt water, always rinse after and make sure the 0-rings are clean.  From reviews it appears that eventually these cameras are going to fail (cannon, olympus), so take care as best you can because it looks like the service life is about 1-3 years.  The olympus is a very good camera, but the slow shutter makes action shots a little hard to catch at times.The Fuji Finepix f200EXR is probably the best point and shoot I have ever had.  I did buy the hype about the new sensor technology and decided to try it out.  I have not been disappointed.  Very good image quality, easy to set up, automatic settings are very good.  The waterproof case is another $159 to an already expensive camera (about $350), but it has fast a shutter (very little shutter lag after you try to shoot), very fast burst, great low light image quality and it is easy to use.  The automatic technology is good, but can be variable even shooting the same subject based on the light and camera position. The drawback is that when in it's waterproof case it is very bulky and will not fit in a wetsuit sleeve.  Surfing picutures have been really good with this camera, but you essentially have to leave your board on the beach and get in the water specifically to photograph the action.  (not a very spontaneous camera).Fuji also makes an inexpensive WP camera (about $120) but the shutter lag is REALLY long (very slow to take the picture once you press press the shutter button).I also compared this with the digital elph on dry land (the elph also has a waterproof case), and the elph also takes very good pictures and might also be an option in this price range (or a little cheaper-probably the same price with the case).  The elph actually was a little better in tough backlighting situations.  Canon also makes a waterproof camera but there appears to be a lot of failures of waterproofing in the reviews, and it looked a little big so I did not try it.  The Canon waterproof camera reviews are pretty good as far as image quality so it may be worth checking out.For the Cyber-shot TX5, I found the picture quality to be very variable when set with the automatic settings (there are limited choices).  Some pictures are great, some pretty bad.  It actually can vary even when you are shooting the  same subject as repositioning the camera can change the setting and change the picture.  (If your picture turns out bad, try repositioning the camera).  Some pictures look a little too bright and colors look almost unreal...although this can be variable so rarely the pictures turn out better than even the Finepix, but most of the time the Finepix wins.  Sometimes it may have nicer looking images because they appear bright/sharp and almost unreal, but in most cases you probably won't be looking for that appearance.The burst speed is very fast (fastest of those I tested) and great for action shots.Shutter lag is minmal (comparatively for WP cameras and point and shoots).No problems with water yet.  The camera has a lower rating for depth and drop height than the olympus, and feels less sturdy.The battery life is a little shortDoesn't give very much control over the settings, but this is a point and shoot so, that's really what it is made for.The sweep panorama mode is really neat, although not something I use a lot.The biggest plus for this camera is it is very small.  It fits anywhere.  I think if you need a small camera (say one that fits in a wetsuit sleeve), that is waterproof, this is probably your best bet for a fast small camera with good image quality.Overall:for a small camerathe cybershot is a very good small camera with a lot of easy to use features.  Very fast, good for action, and portable enough to be in the action.  variable photo quality, but usually good to very good.  I'm still playing with the cybershot so there may be more good things or more bad things about it, but so far I'm fairly happy with it.  Too new to really comment on durability.The olympus, very tough, good photo quality, also small, but a little slow for action (that said I took action pictures with it for 2 years).  might be a better camera if you are going to abuse it.for image quality (using a point and shoot):may be best to get a regular point and shoot with a waterproof case. FujiFinepix f200EXR would be my vote, Very good amateur surf photography camera in the water (but can't really surf if you have the camera with you).  Tough case, rated deep enough for scuba diving.UPDATEStill working great with very nice surfing shots.  The Burst feature is excellent.UPDATEStill very tough, no leaking, good for surfing shots.  Still love the burst feature.  Little annoyances: Lens is very close to the edge of the camera, sometimes catches my finger...my fault, but very annoying.  Finding with more use that comparatively the picture quality is not that great (just variable, still sometimes is great).  Comparing a far less expensive elph, the photo-quality is consistently better with the elph.  It still takes very good pictures, and I think for a portable camera that you can take surfing, there is no equal, but outside of that niche there are cameras with consistently better photo quality. (every once in a while it still captures something amazing and different than my other cameras, but consistency is important).UPDATEdowngraded to 3 stars.  The paint on the front cover suddenly peeled off.  very odd.  Starting to get stiff with the sliding cover no matter how much you rinse it.  It is still fast, still has a great burst feature, but photoquality still variable (now I only use it in the water, other small cameras are better), inconsistent.  One new problem is that the lens cover doesn't repel water very well anymore, so sometimes it does not focus or there is a drop on the lens and you can't take a good picture until it clears.  Still is small and handy, just maybe showing it's age.  (about 2 years old)

Reviews.Title: The best waterproof point and shoot on the market today.
Reviews.Author: nw_pentax
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon D10, Panasonic TS2, and the Sony TX5 and tested them side by side.  The photo quality was a toss up between the TS2 and the TX5 most of the time with the exception of tricky lighting situations.  I am typically a DSLR photographer so using a point and shoot camera is a bit like going back in time.  However, with the Sony TX5 it did not completely feel this way.  Having a CMOS sensor instead of a CCD (like most other point and shoot cameras) gives this camera better low light shooting performance.  If you are more into shooting video than stillshots, the TS2 might be a better choice as they have a better video capture encoding than Sony (not that Sony's is bad by any means) but Panasonic's is better.Things I love most about the TX5:-It feels good in your hand and looks good too!  It doesn't look like it is trying to convince you with its rivets and armor look that it is tough... it just is and remains stylish and sexy at the same time.  Kudos to that!-The TX5 has a a great "Intelligent Auto" shooting mode that picks the best settings for you based on your composition and light meter readings.  Whether your subject is backlight (where the camera will take an underexposed image and an overexposed image and blend them together to make a high dynamic range photo (handheld) which is quite impressive, or you are shooting in low light handheld and the camera will shoot many shots in rapid succession and make the best photo it can from the group, to the specialized scene modes for underwater, snow, beach, fireworks, high speed shutter for sports/action shots, etc... they all do what they claim.-This camera has one of the fastest start up times and also will shoot at 10 frames / second which is amazing for a point and shoot camera!-Sony finally got smart and allowed the owners to use SD cards in Sony cameras... its about time!Things I don't really love about the TX5:-This camera has only one spot on the whole body to attach any kind of tether.  I know many p&s; cameras are this way with their little wrist lanyards but it would be great if they could put a matching one on the other side so I could use a neckstrap or something to hold the camera hands free while shooting video, etc.-While the images generally look good, there are some photos that do come out less than stunning.  Sometimes "Intelligent Auto" mode selects the wrong preset and the results are not pretty.-The touchscreen is a bit oversensitive and often I find myself accidentally pushing buttons when I didn't mean to.-The camera is so thin and with almost the entire rear being a touchscreen, there is not much to hold on to.  Sometimes it can be slippery in the hands and hard to hang on to.-The lens is fairly wide but if Sony really wants to compete with adventure/sports cameras like the GoPRO HD, it needs a wider angle lens (or attachment).While the photos generally look good and the in-camera editing much more useful than most other cameras, any prints bigger than 5x7 (depending on the light conditions the photo was shot in) and you may start seeing the noise reduction and/or sharpening artifacts that Sony uses in the their cameras to make better straight out of camera photos.Bottom line : After testing the top 3 contenders in the waterproof/freezeproof/and tough cameras, I know I made the right decision to go with the Sony TX5.  It is fun to use, versatile, captures some great photos with minimal effort (regardless of being on a beach mid-day or en la discotecta at night)... This camera ROCKS!  I woudl recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to have to baby and worry about their camera getting wet, dropped, etc.  Even outside the waterproof camera realm, I don't think there are many point an shoot cameras (especially in this price range) that take as nice of photos as this camera.  The waterproofing, drop proof, freezeproof, etc are all just bonus items on an already great camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: David A. Young "dayoung24"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our recent trip to Disney World.  My wife primarily wanted a compact camera to fit in our pockets, and I wanted a waterproof/rugged camera that took good quality indoor and outdoor pictures and HD video (with the ability to zoom during video).  The large touchscreen and easy touchscreen controls were both an added bonus with the TX5!  It was great to be able to use our good quality camera on water rides and at the pool where many other cameras couldn't go!  The underwater picture mode takes amazing high quality color pictures, and the video mode works very well underwater even at night!  My only minor complaints are that the flash is a little weak (understandable given the compact size) and that the finish gets marred with finger prints very easily (but it also wipes clean easily).  I will most likely purchase a 2nd battery to make sure it lasts through an entire day of pictures and videos.  I would definitely recommend this camera to busy families who don't want to worry about destroying their camera in almost any condition or having enough room to always have it with them for those unexpected photo opportunities!

Reviews.Title: Sony Customer Service RUINED this camera for me!
Reviews.Author: rnnrbaby
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera, for a week.  It took great pictures on a beach vacation, and video too. I took VERY good care of it according to the manufacturer's directions. Upon return, following manufacturer's recommendations, I called to find out where to get it cleaned by a sony certified shop.  The lady told me it was under warranty, just send it in, they would be glad to do it for free.  Then they email a week later, the cover was missing and it would be over $200 to fix.  After 3 disconnected calls and three transfers, the "highest" up man said, "sorry".  They would rather lose my confidence, and hopefully yours too, than do the right thing.  The cover was NOT missing, it was a week old, sent in original packaging!  If it had been missing, I would have taken responsibility.  Sorry doesn't cut it Sony.  I would go with the Panasonic (and am going to as soon as I save enough money for ANOTHER camera, I shelled out more than I planned on this one thinking Sony would last a couple of years if I took care of it like I have the last 15 years with them!).  GO with Olympus or Panasonic, Sony doesn't care!  Schiesters probably took the case off to clean it and then wanted to charge me for it!  ugh!

Reviews.Title: OK Camera as long as you're always near a power outlet.
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I previously owned the Sony DSC-T9 and was really happy with the camera.  I mostly use my cameras for hiking/camping/backpacking, and when the T9 died I thought it would be really nice to have a camera that was waterproof, freezeproof, shockproof, etc.  So I bucked up and paid a premium for the Sony DSC-TX5.  At first glance out of the box, I was really impressed...nice looking camera, seems well built, all told it seemed to be a nice replacement for the T9.  Upon first use, I realized that the image quality was similar to the T9, which is to be expected from a compact point and shoot camera.The problem with this camera comes when you don't have a power outlet handy...on a full charge, taking maybe 10 or 12 pictures, the battery on the camera will last about two days.  Not particularly handy when you're out backpacking or staying places where there isn't a readily available wall outlet...the primary reason I bought this camera.  I could make the T9 last for an entire week on a hike...this TX5 will barely get me to the trailhead before the battery dies.  I've returned the camera to Sony under warranty, and they say it's working fine.  So they're verified that it's a piece of junk, and operating under their spec.If the only reason you want this camera is to take pictures of your friends at events and you come home every night to charge it...you can do better on picture quality.  If you're buying it for any sort of use where the shockproof, freezeproof, waterproof might be useful...make sure you buy about 20 extra batteries, which are really handy when you're trying to cut weight carrying a backpack!

Reviews.Title: Camerea is not reliable, and SONY has BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
Reviews.Author: Eagle
Reviews.Content: I bought the Tx5 less than a year ago. I was happy with it while it worked. It took good pictures, and worked as advertised for a while. However, one day it just stopped working. I did not drop it or do anything that would cause it to stop working. I was always very careful to make sure the latches were locked and the seals were clean before I put it into water. It was never dropped from anywhere near 5 ft.I sent it off to Sony for repair, and they said it had corrison and that it was not covered under warranty. They said that the warranty does not cover physical damage. I was very disappointed with the reliability of the camera and Sony's customer service. It is a nice camera, but it costs way too much for Sony to not stand behind their product.  Stay away from Sony.  They do not stand behind there products, and their customer service is terrible!!

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS!
Reviews.Author: Ben Hammond
Reviews.Content: I got this camera about a year ago and at first loved it, has great functions, easy to use, etc.Then i started having problems, first the paint started peeling off the cover, not affecting performance, but making it look shabby.  Then water somehow got inside the camera body.  I never took the camera deeper than 5ft, never had the battery cap open in the water, always made sure there were no sand or debris in the battery area and generally took good care of the camera (i had an olympus waterproof and the seal dried out, letting water in, very sad).So water got into the camera, it limped along for a day or so, i tried to dry it out, but ultimately it died.  Since it was still within warranty, i sent it back to Sony.Sony has since tried to tell me they will not repair the camera, even though it is under warranty, because the damage was caused by water, which voidds the warranty.  This is BS as it's a waterproof, shockproof camera!  I never exceeded the limitations of the camera, was never rough with it, kept it in a case, etc.  There is no understandable reason why the camera let water in, in the first place, and it is even less understandable that Sony won't honor the warranty.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA.DO NOT BUY A SONY PRODUCT!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Little Everyday Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Needed a new camera for a one week family vacation: whale watching, rafting, hiking and the sorts.  Our old camera is an old Nikon Coolpix 5000 (about 7yrs old) and a cheap Fuji (age unknown).  Needed a durable waterproof camera that was more modern.  Compared with other durables as Olympus and Panasonic.  Went with the Sony because of others' reviews and wife wanted the touch screen NEATO feature.Well, is this one camera for us!  Superfast shots, love the shot bursts, and awesome panorama shots of our senic views.  Family friend had an Olympus; couldn't keep up with shooting, especially on the whale watching excursion and changing camera settings.Software: Just offloaded the pics to the computer via the provided software...wow, the software is great.  Welcome me to the modern age of photo albuming I guess.  The software cataloged ALL my pics that was scattered on my computer and central albumed the pics.  Also the software has an facial analyzing tool, cool (haven't tested it yet though).Beware:  DO NOT BUY the off-brand replacement batteries at this time even though they classified to fit this camera because they do NOT.  I bought 2 of them, 1 each from different suppliers and none fit.  They're too large.  Arghhh, oh well, they're cheap, tossed them out for recycle at HOMEDEPOT.  Went and got 2 originals from a big box store, was in hurry for trip.Battery: I guess for their tiny size, their longevity is okay; most days on the vacation, only consumed 1 battery life, but the more video shots you make, the faster the battery consumption.  Only 1 day on our vacation did I actually had to utilized the 3rd battery.Bought a 16gig SD card w/ camera, wasn't sure how much I really needed for the vacation trip so I overdid it with capacity.  I roughly figured that 16gig/10meg=1,600 shots.  Well, it actually came out to about some 3,000 available shots when I installed the card at max resolution.  The camera was so fun to shot, we nearly filled up the card at about 2,700 shots taken during the 1 week trip.  Never did we take so many pictures before.... owe it to the camera, it was a plearsure to use.Touch screen: finger prints wasn't a problem.  After we got used to the location of the icons, the touch screen us super fast vs the old buttons and toggle method.  You end up using both index fingers on your hand to make setting changes.With this camera, we really came into the modern age in our picture taking (didn't use the word photography because I don't consider myself one).  Our next purchase is an SLR or mid SLR to complete the camera lineup.

Reviews.Title: Great all-around package in one camera
Reviews.Author: Philip "bikeboy"
Reviews.Content: I got my Sony Dsc-tx5 a couple days ago in the mail from Amazon. One of the first things I noticed was how slim and nice it looked. Compared to the other waterproof cameras I saw, this one definitly stood out because of its styling, and being waterproof. I was looking for a "durable" camera because I take mine everywhere. This one seemed like an ideal camera because I do take more-then-the-average person "artsy" shots, but also it was waterproof. I am really pleased with the image quality of this camera. Comapared to other waterproof cameras I tested, this one's image quality seemed much better, and I am telling you, it is! I especially like the low-light settings, which seem to work really well. Another part of the camera that i like and appreciate taking closer shots, is the function where you can tap the touchscreen to tell the camera where to focus. this is really useful in close-ups where the camera will not focus where you want it to. Another thing i like is the panorama shot, which contrary to popular belif (in reviews that I read) you can use it with just your hands and it works perfectly fine.Now for the [few] cons. One of the first things I noticed after getting the camera wet that was a little tiresome was the sliding cover smearing water on the lens. If water gets under the cover, it stays under for awhile, and puts dots on the lense if you don't wipe it off every time you open it. The only other thing that i disliked about the camera was its usb port. It is located right next to the battery compartment, and has a single flimsy door that opens to let you plug it in. It seems that this door could easily be snapped off, and thus comprimise the water-proofing of the camera.All in all, though, this camera is definitly worth investing in, if you have the cash. Higher then normal picture quality with the ability to take some really good shots, good low light photographs, and waterproofing...This camera brings it all to the table with one compact package.Update: I've had this camera for over a year now, and still love it! I noticed that they came out with a new model now, and maybe they fixed some of the cons listed above. For now, the only other cons I would add is that the paint on the front slide cover chips off, down to the metal underneath, not that big of an issue. Also, the touch screen can be a little tedious to use at first, and water seems to have gotten under the protective layer of the screen, not compromising anything but the viewing experience. Lastly, the flash is fairly weak, but that is expected from such a small camera. All in all, a great investment for a do-(almost)-anything camera

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Stacy
Reviews.Content: The are very few things that I can complain about with this camera. It takes a really great picture, its fast, its tough and it is smaller than a cell phone. Probably the only things I could be critical about would be the zoom and possibly that it is overly good with lower light situations...it brightens the scene more than I find appropriate (this is easily fixed in the program auto settings) The x4 zoom does very little to bring in any distant subjects. This lens captures a very wide angle so the zoom can be used to narrow the field of view a bit.I originally purchased the camera to use while kayaking, so the waterproofing was a priority. I tested this in a glass of water and a sink. Video and picture functioned fine underwater and the camera is still functional afterward. I have no plans taking the camera any deeper than rolling my kayak will take it, so I believe this test should suffice.I will upload some of my pictures from this camera. Like I had said, I think it takes great pictures, and I like the camera very much. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: this camera is not tough
Reviews.Author: sony no more
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 3 weeks ago and after using it the first time in my swimming pool at home it started leaking water on the exact same day.  Called support and they said to send it in to the support center.  Got a call back a week later saying that it's not covered under warranty because there's a corrosion and a screw missing in the camera.  I know I did not mess with any screws so this is an obvious excuse to not resolve a more serious issue with this camera. BE WARN THAT THIS CAMERA WILL NOT FUNCTION AS ADVERTISE AS A TOUGH CAMERA AND SONY WILL NOT STAND BEHIND IT SAYING THAT IF THERE'S WATER DAMAGE THEN NO WARRANTY.

Reviews.Title: Updated from "Decent for a Rugged Camera" to "DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA"
Reviews.Author: Trekker "Gabe"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 1 Year Later (6/21/11):  My Sony TX-5 is DEAD!!! Just this weekend, I took it to the pool, had it in the water (no more than 2 ft deep) and the camera stopped working.  I took it home and removed battery with memory card and noticed that the battery and memory card were a little wet.  Obviously the water seal for the battery compartment did not do its job.  Anyway, I've left the battery compartment open to see if it would dry out and maybe work again, but it hasn't happened.  This camera is marketed as waterproof and we bought it for that reason, but it died because of the water.  With a price tag of $350 and only lasting 1 year, it is a terrible product.  I'm not sure I will ever purchase a "waterproof" camera again.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I am probably a bit more experienced than a complete novice photographer, but still consider myself a casual shooter.  I have only had the TX5 for a few days now, but have had time to develop a few first impressions. Here is the breakdown of my impressions on a few features:Ruggedness -  I have not tested the ruggedness of the camera as of yet.  I have not dunked it in water, put it in the freezer, or dropped it on the ground.  The camera does seem to be well built though.  If anything, I question the ruggedness of the touch screen.  It just seems like such a sensitive feature to have on a "rugged" camera.  Even though its a rugged camera, I am not really experiencing a carefree mentality with it because I'm worried about breaking or scratching the touch screen.Touchscreen - The screen has an ok resolution, but is not on par with other cameras at this price range.  Just a bit disappointing.  As far as the touch operation, it seems to be pretty effective.  The TX5 responds more effectively to a "touch" vs. a "tap"  such as on other touch screen products like the iPhones. But with a "touch", it works nicely.Interface:  It is quite intuitive.  I have learned how to operate the camera and did not need to open the manual.  Its very nice that you can customize a quick access sidebar menu that allows you to make certain camera adjustments.  It allows you to customize this sidebar menu for each camera mode and scene selection.  Very helpful.Camera Modes: Intelligent Auto Adjust seems to work pretty well.  Its not 100% accurate for a casual shot, but no camera is.  iSweep has worked well too and is fun to use.  I think I will get good use out of Hand-held Twilight and Backlight Correction HDR modes because they do seem to help in those challenging conditions.  The high speed 10 pics per second may be a bit disappointing.  I shot at a high burst speed in lower light conditions and I got 10 blurry pictures.  Maybe it works better in brighter conditions.Photo Quality:  Overall, the camera seems to have good quality pics. Not great, but good.  This is based on how pics look on camera and computer.  I have not yet printed photos to comment on their results.

Reviews.Title: BEST EVERY DAY CAMERA OUT THERE. GREAT INVESTMENT.
Reviews.Author: J. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: OK A FEW THINGS FIRST. I MUST BE VERY CONFIDENT THAT YOU MUST BE VERY CONFUSED IN REGARDS TO WHAT WATERPROOF CAMERA YOU SHOULD GET.WELL, YOU CAME TO THE RIGHT PLACE. THERE ARE A FEW THINGS MISSING ON THIS CAMERA BUT NOTHING TO BE A DEAL BREAKER. I WAS ABLE TO COMPARED THIS CAMERA WITH THE BEST WATERPROOF CAMERAS OF 2010. (CANON D10, OLYMPUS 8010 , CASIO EX-G1 , PENTAX W90 AND THE PANASONIC TS2). THE SONY TX5 BEAT ALL THESE OTHER CAMERAS IN PICTURE QUALITY. IN ROUGHNESS I WOULD SAY THE PANASONIC TS2 AND THE OLYMPUS 8010 ARE THE TOP 2 BUT THE PICTURE QUALITY ON THESE TWO DEVICES TURNS TO CONVERT THOSE CAMERAS INTO POSSIBLE DEAL BREAKERS. THE QUESTION YOU NEED TO ASK YOURSELF IS , WHY DO YOU WANT TO BUY A WATERPROOF CAMERA? DO YOU SIMPLY WANT ONE TO REPLACE YOUR OLD DIGITAL CAMERA AND HAVE A NEW CAMERA YOU CAN TAKE WITH YOU EVERYWHERE YOU GO WITHOUT TO WORRY ABOUT RUINING YOUR ELECTRONIC DEVICE OR BECAUSE YOU ARE GOING TO BE USING THE CAMERA IN THE WORST ENVIRONMENTS OUT THERE? FOR EXAMPLE: IF YOU ARE ONLY GOING TO GET A WATERPROOF CAMERA TO GO TO A THEME PARK, THE POOL, SNORKELING, SKIING, THE CLUBS WHEN YOU GO OUT AT NIGHT THEN THE TX5 IS THE ONE FOR YOU. THIS BABY WON'T EMBARRASS YOU WHEN YOU PULL THIS THING OUT AT A NIGHT CLUB SINCE THIS CAMERA LOOKS VERY SEXY. IF YOU ARE THE CONSTRUCTION LUMBERJACK TYPE OF GUY OR YOU SURF AND DO SCUBA DIVING, ROCK CLIMBING WITH YOUR BUDDIES AND YOU NEED SOMETHING TO WITHSTAND A LOT OF PAIN WHILE DOING THOSE ACTIVITIES, THEN YOU CAN PROBABLY LOOK INTO THE PANASONIC TS2 AS A SECOND CHOICE BUT THEN AGAIN YOU WILL BE SACRIFICING SOME PICTURE QUALITY IN THE PROCESS.GOOD LUCK WITH YOUR RESEARCH.I WOULD RANK THEM LIKE THIS:1. SONY TX52. PANASONIC TS23. CANON D104.OLYMPUS 80105. PENTAX W906. CASIO EX-G1

Reviews.Title: 2 months later and still impressed! Incredible camera!
Reviews.Author: SF real
Reviews.Content: Ok so this is a fantastic camera.  I'm blown away by the low light shots. They are incredible!  No flash and you get a really clear pic at night!  Amazing, simply amazing.It's a really fun camera and I highly recommend it.The only downside is the scratchability of the screen.  It will scratch.  It's not glass.  It's a plastic  screen so be sure to get a protector.  I had my camera less than 24 hours and scratched it up.  I was majorly disappointed can called sony to complain.  Sony took amazing care of me.Sony is replacing the camera and paying for all the shipping. I'm not really sure why other people have had such problems with Sony's customer service.  They were incredible to me.I love how rough I can treat this camera.  It's great for the beach!

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after underwater use
Reviews.Author: J. J. Twohey
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera for the first 6 months of having it. I went snorkeling in Hawaii at shallow calm waters and after that the camera stopped working! The whole reason I purchased this was to be waterproof. I did everything right making sure all the latches were closed properly. I am sending it back to sony as it is still under warranty. However I am worried they won't fix it based on the other reviews I've read. I will update when I find out what they will do.

Reviews.Title: Soooo disapointed!
Reviews.Author: Bookgirl "Bookgirl"
Reviews.Content: Sony outdid themselves with this piece of junk.  First off the camera is just hard to hold.  I have small hands and still manage to get my fingers of my left hand into several of the shots.  The only way to avoid taking pictures of my fingers is the hold it tea cup style with only my index fingers and thumbs with the rest of my fingers fanned in the air, a perfect way to drop your camera.  With my last Sony, I would slide the shield down with my middle finger, and take a picture with my ring finger, all in a matter of seconds using only my right hand; no kidding!  This camera's shield is quite difficult to manage without two hands.  The shield doesn't slide easily, and I usually have to hook my fingernails in to get it open.  What's more, now that all the features are accessible only by the way of touch screen, you have to memorize where every thing is or you will be missing lots of shots.  And because the touch screen is so sensitive, if you accidentally touch the screen in between shots, you will have turned on or off a feature that you didn't mean to and you will have to figure out what you did before your next shot.  Also because the sensitivity of the playback screen, when you are reviewing your pictures, they will fly by faster than you can see them.  Forget trying to edit right on the camera, the screen is just too sensitive.  Then there is the lack of picture quality. And this is where there is just no excuse!  Many of my pictures are blurry and dark.  I have owned several digital cameras (most Sony) over the years and I've never seen so many out of focus shots.  If you don't hold the camera absolutely still, you can count on getting a glowing, double-exposure type of shadow around your subject.  The only good pictures are the ones I have taken outside.  And sadly, after reading some of the other reviews, I'm too scared to get my new overpriced camera wet.

Reviews.Title: I am so happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This has been a great camera for me. I use it canoeing, swimming, jet-skiing, snowboarding and for snapping party shots. Touchscreen works underwater!The only thing keeping this camera of 5 stars is the battery life. I get about 90 minutes of video OR 200 pictures give or take 50 pics with the flash on/off and using burst of panorama modes which use a lot of processing power. I would recommend a class 6 SD card.The most enjoyable functions are panorama and handheld twilight, which lets you take amazing pictures in low light conditions. The videos are great too!

Reviews.Title: Wait, it's also waterproof?*updated*
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Update 2 years later. Camera failed underwater (one foot of water). It said "overheating",which was odd, since it was in water at the time. I took it out, and It no longer works. I may have to check the battery to see if it needs replacement. Not terribly happy with the current product.---old review follows----(originally 5 stars)Whipping this little camera out of your pocket is quite easy, when it's smaller than some cellphones.Then tapping on the touchscreen to get what you want gets the fun going. Then when you dunk it under water, the people, they excite.Reasons why I picked this one over the waterproof lumix ts2, and the others like the pentax optio series:* It doesn't look like a waterproof camera* It still has a slider to protect the lens (unlike the lumix)* It has a cmos sensor, re-designed for the best low light performance in a camera that small* HD videoThose are just the reasons why it stuck out as the winner to me (It took me a week of back and forth analyses)CONS! Always cons!* Battery life is mediocre. you'll get through a day's worth  of shooting, barely (about 250 pix+some short vids for me in one day, dead battery)* The slider will open in your pocket sometimes, but that's much easier to deal with than a lens extruding* I've had the camera for about a month, and the battery indicator is burning into the lcd. tisk tisk sony.* touch screen is hard to see in bright areas.With those cons mentioned, i wouldn't recommend buying this camera until it drops below it's msrp by a bit, otherwise, this is the waterproof camera to go with.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: K. A. Swenson II
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for fly fishing, more specifically a trip to Montana, and then for continued use as the family trip point and click. I can say that I was very impressed with this little Sony the entire time.  This camera is not only small but durable and waterproof.  This camera was my constant companion through out the trip and it never disappointed.The panoramic option is extremely easy to use, just stand in one spot and rotate 180 degrees and it puts the picture together no problem.  The auto option is extremely versatile, it can go from close ups (less than an inch from the subject) to face recognition portraits in a flash. It is rugged as well; I put the camera through the paces, one to four feet underwater in 50-60 degree rivers for up to 45 seconds.  It lived in the pocket of my fishing vest and and the bottom of the river for the entire time (save for nightly sessions reviewing the days catch and scenery).I cannot speak to any use other than my own, but if you are looking for a small, rough & tumble, waterproof camera this exceeded my expectations in both quality of the pictures as well as durability.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Dead pixels, poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Joel P. Henderson
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived with dead pixels on the LCD screen.I spent an hour on the phone with Sony support trying to get help. Finally a Sony senior manager took the call and said that Sony recognizes that dead pixels are an issue with Sony LCD screens in cameras.She said to send the camera to Texas for 7-10 days to replace the LCD screen, but she warned that the replacement LCD screen may have even more dead pixels, and that there is no way to have te repair center test the replacement LCD screen before shipping it back to me.She also said that it could be that the camera sensor is broken so replacing the LCD screen won't help.So I'm returning the camera to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy This Camera - Sony Does Not Honour Warranty
Reviews.Author: Sean Greenwood
Reviews.Content: I along with my neighbor purchased this camera and like others on this review site the paint started peeling after 1 month and the battery cover malfunctioned making it inoperable in water but it was still able to take pictures.I sent this to sony for the warranty repair to be done. They declined to fix it and when it came back the battery cover would not even close and it now cannot be used.Do not trust this product's warranty or its longevity.

Reviews.Title: this camera sucks
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Coming off Canons I had high hopes and was disappointed.  the camera is very difficult to use, not intuitive like the Canons.  Also stores files with different labels that do not allow simple up loads to picasa. Save your money buy the canon.

Reviews.Title: Sony's Warranty Process is a Nightmare
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera ... in fact don't buy anything from Sony. If it breaks and you have to return it you'll have to deal with their repair facility in Laredo which will give you the worst customer service you've ever experienced. They won't honor the warranty and they'll make sure you have a horrible experience while they do it. Look at the other reviews of this camera for horror stories about the warranty and learn from our mistake. DON'T BUY SONY

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kyle Martin
Reviews.Content: I love my new Sony waterproof camera.  The dry picture quality is great, everything to expect from a Sony.  The underwater picture quality is good, not the greatest but I have only tried it on days with poor visibility.  The video mode is excellent and the auto picture mode is usually right on.I have taken the camera down to about 15 feet and have jumped off a 30 ft platform into the water with it in my pocket.  It has held up well so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: shay
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera about 4 months ago. im rough on cameras and go through them pretty quick. the fact that this is a rugged camera pretty much was the selling point for me as well as it being water proof. the camera has been the best i have ever owned. i have used it many times in my inground pool with no problems. it takes great quality pictures in the water and out of the water. the video is awesome as well. overall i am very pleased and hope it continues to hold up for a long time.only complaint i had to the seller was i ordered a black camera and recieved a silver one. not that big a deal and i really didnt have time to send it back before i needed to use it. so i just kept the silver one. .

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jermwhl "jermwhl"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a replacement for the Olympus camera that is waterproof.  Great decision on my part.  The picture quality is so much better.  While the Olympus looks more rugged, I feel that the Sony will be a lasting product as well.  The Olympus' waterproofing failed after a year, this Sony has very little that I can see where it would fail.  The quality of the camera seems well designed.  The drop proof portion I would not be willing to test on purpose, but I don't really like "drop testing" things.  If it lives up to that, I would be that much happier.  Photo quality, both in water and out are great, in my opinion.  Video underwater is amazing too.  I couldn't believe how crisp the video was.  No regrets with this camera.  Battery life is a bit short, agree with other reviews about getting a spare battery.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: mnbimmer99
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good for a point and shoot, even without the waterproof functionality.  The camera shell is not the most durable, though it is strong and performs as advertised.  A fumbled handoff chipped a small amount off the corner and it appears to scratch easily, but it created zero issues with the camera or it's functionality.  The underwater filming is amazingly clear, i was very, very impressed.  This is not like a disposable waterproof clunker at all.The camera itself may not be as slim as some on the market, it is definitely the slimmest waterproof camera, and it fits comfortably in both my and my gf's hands.  Note:  The camera does not turn itself off automatically.  We learned this on a camping trip where we left the lens cover open and it drained the battery from full to empty.  It was our fault, but it would be a handy feature.So though I have pointed out a couple of flaws with the camera, it truly is remarkable how clear the images are, and how well fast images come out.  The screen is a touch screen, but it smudges very, very easily.  This was frustrating at first, but the screen is bright and it can be lived with.  It is incredibly easy to use but with some fine tuning a more advanced photographer will have an opportunity to play with some settings.  All in all, a very good camera that can be tossed to the kids but will definitely bring your memories home with you in stunning clarity.

Reviews.Title: Sony Sucks and so does their Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Carole Bellacera "Carole Bellacera"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera--used it for less than a year, then it stopped working after the ONE time I took it underwater.  Shallow water, too.  Sent it back because it was still under warranty, and guess what?  They said I broke it and they won't honor the warranty.  There was nothing VISIBLE broken on this camera.  I will NEVER buy another Sony camera again.

Reviews.Title: Needs improvement
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: I've had my TX5 for about a month now and I've used it in every intended way it's designed for.  Overall, it could be a very good camera and has features that work very well but it's shortcomings offset the good:REASONS I BOUGHT IT:- Nice compact and slim size- Waterproof, shockproof, and dustproof- Above average picture quality especially in low light- Useful shooting modes: burst, panoramic sweep, low light, macro, etc.- Good video quality even underwater.- Intuitive touchscreen controlsREASONS WHY I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND BUYING THIS CAMERA:- Paint on body/housing especially on lens cover chips off very easily; seems like a manufacturing defect- Viewfinder location not the best, easy to accidentally get your finger in the shot.- Auto zoom function very "buggy"; sometimes just randomly zooms in and out even when you don't want it to.- Very short battery life especially when shooting video.- Touchscreen scratches very easily- Does not come with a carrying case- Sony customer service sucks!  Unresponsive and not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: The ultimate camera!
Reviews.Author: joe man.
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, compact, and doesn't look impressive. However, I have taken amazing pictures with this little thing. Because if it's waterproof nature, and compact design, I was able to take it with me around the world and capture great memories. I took this little thing in many a pool, the pacific ocean, the Caribbean sea, and the waters around southern Thailand. I also dropped it when I mountain climbed in Thailand, and it even survived being covered in paint during a Caribbean Carnival celebration.The Cyber-shot may not take the best pictures, especially at night, but the convenience and size of it will enable you to take many pictures that other people wouldn't dare take for fear of damaging their precious SLRs.I just bought the newest version of this camera, because I fear after 3 years of heavy use, It's on it's last leg. I hope the new camera will be cable to capture as much memories as this one did.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a pocket camera that could take a little more abuse, this camera has far exceeded my expectations.  It has survived countless days/weeks/months in an outer pocket of a backpack with keys and other metal objects with little damage.  The camera is not unscratchable, but it is TOUGH (if i had put a screen protector on the LCD you would have no idea the camera had been bounced/dropped/kicked around in a pocket next to keys, even without it there are still only tiny scrapes on the screen).  Its had all varieties of beverages spilled on it with no issues at all.The camera is available to take a picture very quickly, only a second or so after the camera is turned on you can snap a picture (including focus time).  The quality of the pictures is great, i'm not a serious photographer, but the pictures taken look nice.  I mostly take pictures on the auto setting, which is pretty adaptive to any given situation and takes a consistently good picture.  The panorama setting is a little odd as this camera prefers you to sweep through the panorama quickly, if you go to slowly it won't work for some reason.  The night mode is one of my favorite bells/whistles on this camera, it takes several pictures with no flash and combines them to raise the light levels in a dark picture, you can use it in really dark situations and get a pretty decent picture without a flash.All in all I am extremely pleased with this camera after more than a year of usage, and I have recommended it to several friends.

Reviews.Title: A great grab and go camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Tosh
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for several years and it died on me.  I liked it so much that I bought another one exactly the same even though there are newer versions of other ruggedized cameras.  It takes great pictures and can be used in harsh environments, even with gloves on.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, overpriced, unreliable
Reviews.Author: km
Reviews.Content: I had my dsc-tx5 for a couple of weeks over a year when my touchscreen stopped working.  As everyone else has been saying, Sony support is bad.  To much money for what you get in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for grandparents to use
Reviews.Author: kas
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a month and already have some great photos of grandkids in action.  I have found the camera touchscreen easy to use and the low-light photos come out great.  I do plan to order a second battery as it seems the battery life is rather shorter than I expected or than I would like so we will plan to travel with a spare one on hand.Happy Grandmother in CT

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera and fantastic video production
Reviews.Author: Pushka "Calliope"
Reviews.Content: We took this camera on a tropical holiday and took many underwater shots.  The video on it is incredibly clear, and the file produced was even clearer than the naked eye.  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: ventuckyspaz
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Turn on and off. Panoramic mode is great. Send the extra money on a nice point and click.Really The Pro's of this camera:-When you like up or down the camera it turns on and is ready to go.-No lens to stick out and messp, et grime into and stuff.-Light weight easy fits pockts (Ad if you forget to turn off you dont have a lens things protruding).-Great pictures. Yes its a 10 MPS but that figure in this moderm world it meaningmess mow. You can have a 14 MPS pansonic that won't et talk the pixels this one will.-Excellent lens-Great low light performance - They have a special mode when can be turned on that take 2 of the same shot blends it together to make the picture unblurred.IF YOU CAN AFFORD THIS CAMERA BUY IY!!!

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Robin M. Watkins "niborkins"
Reviews.Content: We just got back from taking it to Jamaica.  We have a waterproof camera for diving and it works great underwater with it's housing, but above water it was lacking.  This Sony camera is so rugged.  I took it to the falls; it took beautiful pictures.  I took it in the pool.  It basically went every where with me in Jamaica and worked great!  It was so nice not having to worry if I could take the camera or not because of rain or chances it would get wet.  At the falls I slipped off a rock and the camera hit one of the rocks...no problem!  Too bad I was carrying the camera it would have been a funny moment to catch!

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Just watch the flash.
Reviews.Author: J. Murdock "Web editor, wedding photographer"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera that has one glaring issue that keeps me from giving it 5 stars. Shoots great, nice photos, easy to use. The waterproof/dustproof aspect is what convinced me to buy it, but it's a great dry-land camera too.But the flash system is flat out awful -- or so it appears at first.I've never had a point-n-shoot so consistently overexpose flash photos under 15 feet away. It would be great if you could adjust the auto flash exposure down a stop or so...but you can't. You can adjust the camera's exposure, but that doesn't help the flash issue.But even more strange is that once you download the photos, the flash photos...aren't so bad. In fact, there's enough difference that I don't think the display is doing an accurate job of showing what you shot with the flash, which is silly. Show me what you took, camera!But there is good news: the camera's non-flash photos are pretty spiffy. So long as you aren't shooting action, the SteadyShot makes it handholdable on wide angle down to a quarter second or so. And you can boost the ISO to 3200 if you need to (you'll get grain, but it's still better than using the flash)Some of the other features seem gimmicky (10 frames a second at full res?), but function well enough that they don't seem tacked on.If Sony would release a firmware that would give you at least some way to dampen the flash output, this camera would be near-perfect (other than the too-small battery, but you can't really have everything)

Reviews.Title: A pleasure to own and use.
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for several months and have nothing but praise for it.  I'd go so far as to say that it is more than what I hoped to get when I bought it in virtually all respects (OK, except for maybe battery life).  I remember how startled I was when I took it out of the box; it seemed such a little, delicate thing, almost jewel-like fresh from the wrapper.  I have owned three other "Elements and Fools proof" cameras and they were armored bricks; none produced very sharp images--they were designed to work anywhere first and well second.  The Sony is slim, light, and elegant, and works great.I admit that I have not put it through a torture test.  Frankly, I cannot imagine spending serious money for anything and then pushing it to see if it fails.  It is, after all, a camera, not a hammer, an anvil, or a frozen pizza. So I cannot attest to its maximal toughness.  But I often carry it in the same poocket as my keys or throw it into my "manny purse" in the same pocket as a Benchmark sailing knife and sundry spare change, fifteen round magazines and other potential scratching paraphenalia. I took it to Italy for two weeks and took hunderds of images, about half of which were indoors, with excellent results.  So far, no nicks or any major scratches (I don't get why so many reviewers seem to have this problem).I have not dealt with Sony. Yet. And have no reason to expect that I'll have to argue over this one.  I surely hope I don't have to.  The last time I dealt with a camera manufacturer over a failed camera was over another brand's waterproof camera that leaked the first time I used it, on my honeymoon in Costa Rica no less. It was a miserable experience; they gave zero satisfaction, accusing me of improperly closing one of the little doors.  I was able to get a refund only by happening to be friends with folks at the shop I bought it from.  I suspect that buying a camera is really like buying a firearm, you bought it, you used it, it's yours.  Period.  You get anything more from them and that is gravy.So my TX5 is my new daily "go to" camera; the one I take fishing, to the beach house and to parties.  It has great low light skills and excellent stabilization. I almost always have it with me and feel naked if I forget it, kind of like my iphone.  I'm sure it isn't perfect, but neither am I.

Reviews.Title: Great Features
Reviews.Author: moitch
Reviews.Content: This product has every feature I needed.  Picture quality, waterproof, drop proof, panarama.  Though my wife's favorit is the smilie feature, it only takes a picture when you are smiling which is gret if you have little kids and are always trying to get them to smile and when they finally do you missed the shot.

Reviews.Title: Nice compact camera
Reviews.Author: justvideo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in order to be able to take photos underwater while snorkeling. I read the reviews for this and other similar cameras and liked this one for it's features and especially the 10fps. I tried it out in a swimming pool before taking it to the ocean. The photos were very good and far exceeded my expectations considering the reviews from some who were disappointed. Under water, especially if you are not weighted down, you just have to point and shoot. It's almost impossible to actually use the LCD screen to frame your shot. However, if you shoot wide and crop later it works fine. The screen is large and bright and works very well in most cases. All that said, the screen did leak. It was a small amount and disappeared in a few hours so I sent the camera back for replacement.I'm looking forward to giving it another try. The down side is that if it still doesn't work refunds are not offered. Neither is the return shipping.

Reviews.Title: Beware Sony Warranty
Reviews.Author: Frank R. Bellacera "Frank"
Reviews.Content: After only 6 months, my Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX5 just stopped working while on vacation. I returned the camera to the repair facility in Laredo, TX (at my own expense).  A couple of weeks later I received an email requesting my authorization to go ahead and repair the camera. The cost estimate was: $45 for labor and $593.58 for parts. WHAT!! The cameras original cost was less than $300. So what about my warranty? When I called the repair facility, a very pleasant young man informed me that their experts found a piece (???) of the camera broken which led to the failure of the camera. They summarily determined that the part was broken by my misuse.  I explained that there was nothing visibly "broken" when I returned the camera (there are only 2 movable parts on the outside of the camera) and that it stopped working in the middle of taking normal snap-shots. That's it. So-sorry! End of warranty. End of story.

Reviews.Title: DSC-TX5
Reviews.Author: jim "jim"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to it's waterproofness and apparent toughness.  It takes great pictures and the interface is easy to use once you figure out where everything is.  Even with all the great features of this camera, I'm going to send it back.  After using it for a couple weeks in water and on dry land, the paint is chipping off.  The camera still works but I thought this was supposed to be a "tough" camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Hannah Bananaz "fall out at my disco"
Reviews.Content: this camera has great quality for it's size and the fact alone that it's lens do not come out, and it is waterproof. the quality underwater is amazing, and it's cool to use. it's been through so much, and i even bought it a second time after the first one broke! the only problem i've ever had with the camera itself is that the latch which holds the battery and memory card secure often breaks, or won't snap back in, which restricts how often and where you can use the camera. this happened to my first one, and now that i've been using my second, the latch is starting to get weird again. it lasts a long time though so i believe it's worth the money, especially since it's hard to find decent quality, both image and video wise in compact point and shoot cameras. i really dig the camera itself and will continue to use it until it breaks again. then i'll upgrade to a larger DSLR body with interchangeable lenses. but this works great, and i would reccomend it to anyone, especially if you love the beach and swimming.

Reviews.Title: Very durable
Reviews.Author: Daniel Williams
Reviews.Content: Other than the few chips out of the finish, this camera has held up well and performs.  Great battery life, takes great pics and video and is compact enough to stick in a pocket.  We purchased a floating wrist strap to keep it from ending up on the bottom of a river or lake, and it allows us to be carefree when playing in the water.  We had originally bought an Olympus waterproof camera, but it took so long from power on until you could take a picture we returned it and bought this and are very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot TX5
Reviews.Author: kim mckenzie
Reviews.Content: Great strong metal body (I wish that Sony had kept that up!!) and wonderful optics and size. This is my go-to camera out of my three.

Reviews.Title: Never been happier with a point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Kristi
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd of 4 Sony cameras over the years and as always, I am not disappointed!  The TX-5 is my favorite point and shoot, especially with the wide variety of features.  The main reason I got it is because we live in Florida and we are in the water all the time. This camera takes awesome video/pics underwater and on land!  It is one tough little camera.  I have since upgraded to the Sony A55 dSLR but this little camera still goes everywhere our family goes!

Reviews.Title: not really waterproof
Reviews.Author: Ak
Reviews.Content: + Very nice pictures, the panorama funcion is very good.- Supposed to be waterproof but after having the camera 2 times in water, all the color from the front cover peeled off, during 3rd time the water got to the camera and it stopped working.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: brookieman
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  It's a little small.  Touch screen could be a little more sensative. Only a 4X zoom. Love the waterproofing though.

Reviews.Title: I am in LOVE with this camera!
Reviews.Author: gatorbabe
Reviews.Content: I have had a cybershot before and I loved it too. That is why it was a no brainer when purchasing this one. This is an all around 5-star product!

Reviews.Title: Great vacation camera!
Reviews.Author: stephanie
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, because it snaps pictures fast. My kids are very active-- 3 and 9-- and I never miss a good shot using this camera. It also has many options for lighting in different situations. It's a great family camera and great quality.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: Got this as a pocket carry camera for those times I don't want to be bringing out my SLR and the crappy smart phone camera won't do.What really sold me on it is the durability/waterproof factor, which I have yet to really test.  Unit seems pretty solid, and thus far has done fine banging around in pockets/car/etc.The picture quality is very good for a P&S;, and the feature set is basic, which is as it should be.The touch screen is not very responsive, and is rather slow, but no big deal, since it's used so infrequently. (Pretty much only to turn flash on and off, couldn't there have been a button for this?)My main complaint so far is battery life.  It seems like this thing goes through the battery in just 3 or 4 times using it, and that's generally without any flash usage.I would have gladly had a slightly larger form factor if I didn't have to feel like it was going to need charging every other time I picked it up.  Carrying a spare battery defeats the purpose, since the idea is the self-contained unit.  (Plus, for some bizarre reason this tiny battery takes HOURS to charge.)So, overall, I like the thing so far, just wish I didn't have to charge it nearly every time I use it to take 10 pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, so so battery life
Reviews.Author: Matthew Hengst
Reviews.Content: I bought this after my last point and shoot met its untimely end on the top of a half frozen sand dune in the middle of a windstorm if that tells you how I treat my electronics.  I was interested in the lack of a moving lens (the failure point of my Canon) and the fact it was supposedly toughened for outdoor use.I travel each week for work and every weekend I'm out hiking, climbing, or peakbagging somewhere and I always have my camera with me.  So far this has been everywhere from the desert to the snow and performed quite well despite freezing temperatures and a few solid impacts.I like sliding the front shield down to turn the camera on and back off as this makes it possible to work with bulky gloves in the snow though you might want to apply a rubber sticker to make it a bit easier to grip.  It does require some explaining when you have someone else take your picture though as it's different from how most cameras work.  The lens behind the shield is flat and easy to clean off if you say get the camera wet or covered in snow.I've been consistently impressed by the low light shots I've been able to capture and have a number of campfire shots that i never thought would have come out.  Also the sweep panorama mode is fun to play with though I found I like the shots better if I switch the direction to up or down and sweep the camera on its side.The biggest drawback is the battery.  I now have two spares for longer trips as I can get about 2.5 days of fairly heavy use out of each battery.  For obvious reasons HDR, panorama, and the low light settings that require processing drain the battery much faster.Also I can't say I'm a big fan of the touchscreen.  I have a number of one second videos that came about because I somehow managed to get the camera mode switched over to the movie mode when I was trying to take a picture.  Also when you do want to switch modes it's cumbersome to go through the touchscreen as opposed to a hardware switch.The cable to plug it in to the computer is non standard which is slightly annoying but you can always just pop the card out and use that.  And each time I open the small flap that covers the cable port I'm convinced I'm going to break the thing off.Oh, and the black covering is a thin foil like layer that came off after a few months of heavy use.  I'd left the sticker on the front and that patch lasted the longest but now the front slide panel is completely silver.As always with cameras the best way to get a feeling for their capabilities is to search a site like Flickr that will show you all the pictures taken by a particular model.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Boomedoc
Reviews.Content: A very good product for a very reasonable price. The quality was good and it was as it appeared. Would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: CPU MALFUNCTION
Reviews.Author: sailormoon
Reviews.Content: HATE SONY CAMERAS.PURCHASED SONY CYBERSHOT TX-5. turned off and on by itself. did not focus.sent it to the sony repair store in Connecticut. paid my own shipping. received it 1 month later and it still did not work.BAD REPAIR SERVICE.now i have $[..] sony credit. i want to buy a canon s95 or f11. or even a panasonic lumix DMC Z57K.i guess when you rely on the computer to be so smart, you are left with nothing when it breaks.they will refund your money if your camera breaks within 14 days minus a restocking fee. 1 year warranty doesnot help for shoddy products.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: kennnnnli
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing purchase. It is so rewarding to take pictures, particularly underwater, and it puts others' point and shoot cameras to shame with the quality of the pictures. So much fun!

Reviews.Title: The little TX5, Not bad at all !
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: For those looking for the the perfect point and shoot that they can slide in there pocket without bulk on any occasion, this little cam in my opinion is a good "pic". As far as the claims on the box about its underwater capabilities and durability? well do you believe everything you read on the box of any product and take it literally? I didn't think so. Of course this is not a Divers Camera, or one to attach to the front of your ATV while diving into mud pits. Trying to get a few shots, I dropped my camera into a bubbling jacuzzi. Took me a minute to find it, pulled it out, wiped some water off the lens a bit, snap a few shots and all was fine. It is in fact a pretty sturdy point and shoot cam with some excellent results for such a cam. I got me a nice "Shield" screen protector and smudge problems were none existent and touch screen works great. It has a pretty intensive menu with many options, so make sure you experiment. I did, and it resulted in some awesome results. I went all out and got a 16gig add in card. You'll have plenty of play room to shoot thousands of pics and sort them out later. I had the camera now for about a year and it has came through on every occasion. Even allowed me to get some quick action shots with excellent results. Last but not least an extra battery is a must, more research could have been put in to increase the battery life but of course this would have resulted in an expensive battery, so I'll take it as is and have an extra with me. Considering the battery is the size of 4 Chiclets, no problem here. Now, off to shoot some more pics with my TX5!!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX5
Reviews.Author: T. Burton "Mapper"
Reviews.Content: You ask for a review only one month after I received the camera.  I have not even finished reading the manual yet.  So far, I like the camera very much.  You should read through the manual to set the camera up.  There are many features that can be adjusted to your style of use.  The camera is also preset to use write out of the box.  I am very happy with the camera so far.

Reviews.Title: buena camara
Reviews.Author: Rene Urdaneta
Reviews.Content: Esta camara era todo lo que habia deseado, la cantidad de funciones te da libertad de hacer con ellas cosas increibles. espero poder disfrutar al maximo de todas las bondades

Reviews.Title: Great camera for living and skiing at Vail
Reviews.Author: Doug Clayton
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Dropped it in the snow a few times and even lived through getting a full beer spilled on it. Picture quality is great. The Night Shot mode is superb and Sony's really stepped up the technology on this. I am normally a Canon guy all the way but the size of this camera and all the tech packed into is unparalleled.Love the Panorama mode! Wish it allowed me to control the size of the panorama though.If I must complain about anything the power button is microscopic and almost impossible to turn on with gloves on. Sure it can be turned on by sliding the lens cover down but I usually forget to put it up. The Battery life is a little short but I usually carry extras. Haven't tried portrait or macro yet but so far the photo quality is good.Something I'd like to see is for sony to use the touch screen for exposure control like the iPhone 3G+ does. Would make sense with it being a touch screen and I don't think it has an exposure lock anywhere that I have found yet.All and all a great camera! I had my first one stolen and I bought another the following day. Can't live without it.

Reviews.Title: Good, fast but, expensive
Reviews.Author: Neale Fetterly
Reviews.Content: Good camera, positive stuff;1.very fast - fastest slim digital camera I've had.2. Takes nice photos.3. Very nice to have a slim camera that has optical zoom - but DOES NOT have a lense that extends out (that is where my Casio's would always break).  Still learning my way around the menu system.4. The low light system is quite nice - not simply just a grainy high iso setting.The not so good side;1. the LCD screen is not really that great for a 3" screen - but okay I wanted the "tough" version for industrial use (my old casio exilim had a clearer screen)2. Battery life - yes it's poor & I have not noticed any real warning.  Fortunately I remembered a gift card in my wallet that was expiring & picked up a spare battery (also - I've bought off-brand batteries for Canon & Casio cameras - no off brand that I could find for this Sony)3. Battery / memory card door - likes to tell me it's not properly closed (I think I need to clean the contacts..)I bought a less expensive "tough" camera for my daughter that was on sale at a "club" store.  It takes nice photos too.  I think this will be a growing segment - I don't really need it waterproof, but at least very humidity proof is good.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: S. Boal "Sheena"
Reviews.Content: This certainly does not take the place of my DSLR, but I have had more fun with this camera over the last several months than any other. I can take it anywhere: snowboarding, biking, kayaking, snorkeling...etc. No worries. Durability is invaluable after I just drowned my poor Olympus in a river.Do your homework: read and understand the specifications before you buy it because they do not lie. You must know what the camera is capable of and find a good match for your needs or you may be disappointed.Picture quality is above my expectations: color saturation is very good in high light situations outside using exposure compensation and low light sensitivity is amazing with little noise. I am also very impressed in the macro focusing and have taken breathtaking photos of spiderwebs with incredible detail. One thing I would change, which is essential and a huge negative, is the finish on the camera should be more durable. In Sony's manual it states not to come into contact with sunscreen or it may damage the finish. Ridiculous. If it is waterproof, you will probably be taking it outside and need sunscreen. Also, use a screen protector, which should be obvious. The camera would also benefit from a viewfinder as the LCD screen is difficult to see in high light situations and you can't tell what you're taking a picture of if the sun is behind you. Lastly, note in the specifications the power of its zoom. This is not an impressive feature, so if that is important to you, look elsewhere.I find myself using the sweep panorama quite a lot and love this feature. It is great for landscapes and stitches the images instantly.Overall, given the nature of this camera and its capabilities, I am very impressed and would recommend it to anyone hard on their cameras or an outdoors enthusiast. It is easy and a pleasure to operate as well.

Reviews.Title: The last or the first?
Reviews.Author: Paul Bachorz "paulbach"
Reviews.Content: This gem should be your first camera or perhaps it could be the last since it does all things so amazing well. 10 shots in a second? 1600 ASA? Automatic stitching of panoramas in the camera? All garner an A+ for ease of use and usability.I bought the TX5 because it would fit easily inside my motorcycle jacket. Mission complete.Any negatives? None about the camera but yet another propriety battery but a small charge against an otherwise superlative camera.

Reviews.Title: DSC-TX5
Reviews.Author: Daniel Reed
Reviews.Content: The camera takes awesome pictures in any setting from almost complete darkness to underwater.  very versatile

Reviews.Title: Excellent all purpose camera!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few weeks now, and I am definitely impressed. It is very sleek, takes amazing photos, and is rugged enough for my purposes.I have gone to the pool several times with this camera and it has preformed superbly underwater. The touch screen works very well, even underwater. My old camera had 10x optical zoom, but I found that to be excessive for me (an average Joe). The 4x zoom is excellent because it doesn't add any bulkiness, while still letting me get a better view when need be.This camera is very lightweight and easily slides in any pocket. The size is very nice for how rugged this camera is. It is a great relief to have this camera, as I am no longer always being extra careful to avoid water and bumping my camera. I can capture images on the go, freely would be my best term to describe it.The quality of the pictures is very nice for me as well. I cannot speak for those who print out photos, but they do make very nice wallpapers on my widescreen monitor. The HDR mode is a very nice touch.Overall, I would recommend this camera for the average (if there even is a thing) camera buyer. It's the perfect mix of rugged, small, and quality. Rugged enough for running around with, small enough to carry around with you all the time, and high quality enough to make nice memories.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Anna Letizia
Reviews.Content: Im really amazed with all the things that this cam can do! its waterproof, hd videos, panorama pics, and very nice image quality. i wish it had more megapixels... =[

Reviews.Title: *UPDATE* Incredible job by sony, TERRIBLE Service
Reviews.Author: Dilip Ramachandran "thamizhan"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 3 months now. it is the only thing out there that is rugged, functional and sleek looking. Well done, Sony.So far the only issue was using it at a beach with not so fine sand and it got into the shutter and scratched up the front... lens is fine though... the instructions did warn me of this! It was fine when I used the camera at a fine sand beach.*UPDATE*Writing after owning this for more than a year. For some reason, in month 13, and during a summer vacation the camera failed completely while using it in a pool (no sand). I tried everything and couldn't figure out what happened to it.I finally decided to send it to Sony support. They were terribly atrocious. At some point they couldn't even find my camera. 1/5 months later, they sent it back to me the way they received it with no next steps. They basically kicked my request to the curb.Final conclusion...PROs: Excellent product that is powerful and beautiful when it works. Nobody combined style and function like Sony did with this camera.CONs: For the price you pay for this camera, it should not have failed as soon as it did. What's worse I was SO disappointed with Sony service that I am concerned about the many Sony products in my home that will soon reach the one year mark.I grew up thinking Sony was one of the companies with an excellent service record, which is one of the reasons you pay the premium (apart from style and brand). But now I will stay away from them.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Picture fan
Reviews.Content: I have had other cameras but nothing compares to Sony. I love it and others have good things to say about it.

Reviews.Title: very good but it can use some improvement
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Heidi M."
Reviews.Content: I owned an Olympus 790SW which work perfectly for d 1st 2 yrs then on its 3rd yr d battery lock got loose n eventually d water seep in n damaged it. While owning the olympus 790Sw, I upgraded to Olympus 850Sw which is not much different from the 790SW but the one I purchased had a bad screen n completely white out d image and even repair by Olympus did not fix it. So I decided to try another brand.I gave Sony TX5 a 4 star because there are some improvement that Sony can work on to make it a 5star. I owned the Sony DSCTX5 for almost 5 months now. on its 2nd month of purchase, we used it on the pool and a few days after I noticed flaking of the exterior of the camera especially on its shutter cover. I called Sony and they advised me to send it to them for repair. For a $300 camera I would think thats bad quality on the part of Sony. We went to the Bahamas and used it for a snorkeling trip . it took great picture while underwater although sometimes the images is dark and not as crisp as I wanted it to be. While in d water, it was hard to review d picture on the screen because of the glare so I just took as much snapshot as I can while the battery holds and reviewed d picture after d experience n deleted the one that did not come out nicely. another thing that Sony can improve on is how to lock d screen, especially when u r underwater coz u can easily bump into d screen n change d setting without u being aware of it n because of d glare u dont even know that d setting have changed so I was shooting video instead of photo or vice versa.

Reviews.Title: Good for the amateurs
Reviews.Author: J. Morgan
